taskDescription: Grignard reagents (alkylmagnesium halides) undergo a general and very useful reaction with ketones. Methylmagnesium bromide, for example, reacts with cyclohexanone to yield a product with the formula C7H14O. What is the structure of this product if it has an IR absorption at 3400 cm–1?
